CssProperty.name: image-orientation
CssProperty.description: This property specifies an orthogonal rotation to be applied to an image before it is laid out.

entry.description: If the image has an orientation specified in its metadata, such as EXIF, this value computes to the angle that the metadata specifies is necessary to correctly orient the image.
The image should be scaled with an algorithm that maximizes the appearance of the image.
The image must be scaled with an algorithm that preserves contrast and edges in the image, and which does not smooth colors or introduce blur to the image in the process.
When scaling the image up, the 'nearest neighbor' or similar algorithm must be used, so that the image appears to be simply composed of very large pixels.

CssProperty.name: image-resolution
CssProperty.description: The 'image-resolution' property specifies the intrinsic resolution of all raster images used in or on the element.

entry.description: The image's intrinsic resolution is taken as that specified by the image format. If the image does not specify its own resolution, the explicitly specified resolution is used (if given), else it defaults to '1dppx'.
If the 'snap' keyword is provided, the computed resolution (if any) is the specified resolution rounded to the nearest value that would map one image pixel to an integer number of device pixels.

CssProperty.name: object-fit
CssProperty.description: The object-fit property specifies how the contents of a replaced element should be scaled relative to the box established by its used height and width.

CssProperty.name: object-position
CssProperty._locComment: In the 'syntax' attribute, translate only the leading word 'Example:'.
CssProperty.description: Determines the alignment of the replaced element inside its box.
